# The `DbgVariableIntrinsic` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This is the common base class for debug info intrinsics for variables. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::DbgVariableIntrinsic</CodeBlock>

Adding a new location operand will always result in this intrinsic using an ArgList, and must always be accompanied by a new expression that uses the new operand. <a href="#a1fb252b26b548e2ed904e02782013abd">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

This is the common base class for debug info intrinsics for variables.

### isAddressOfVariable() {#a8c005ab74340f04df81ce12b8511a27a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::DbgVariableIntrinsic::isAddressOfVariable () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Does this describe the address of a local variable.

True for dbg.declare, but not dbg.value, which describes its value, or dbg.assign, which describes a combination of the variable&#39;s value and address.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/intrinsicinst-h/#l00343">343</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/intrinsicinst-h">IntrinsicInst.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### isValueOfVariable() {#a26dfaa3ce6f23365ff2ce9a105514ac7}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::DbgVariableIntrinsic::isValueOfVariable () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Determine if this describes the value of a local variable.

It is true for dbg.value, but false for dbg.declare, which describes its address, and false for dbg.assign, which describes a combination of the variable&#39;s value and address.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/intrinsicinst-h/#l00351">351</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/intrinsicinst-h">IntrinsicInst.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### location&#95;ops() {#a1aee0a03668ffd951c891317d8a0c30e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>iterator&#95;range&lt; location&#95;op&#95;iterator &gt; DbgVariableIntrinsic::location&#95;ops () const</>}>
Get the locations corresponding to the variable referenced by the debug info intrinsic.

Depending on the intrinsic, this could be the variable&#39;s value or its address.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/intrinsicinst-h/#l00313">313</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/intrinsicinst-h">IntrinsicInst.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/intrinsicinst-cpp/#l00091">91</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/intrinsicinst-cpp">IntrinsicInst.cpp</a>.
